set.p: The action takes place in Catfish Row, Charleston, South Carolina, USA, at the beginning of the 20th century.

div.head: ACT ONE
div.stage: The action takes place in Catfish Row, Charleston, South Carolina, USA, at the beginning of the 20th century.

div.head: Scene 1
div.stage: (Evening, Catfish Row is quiet. Jasbo Brown is at the piano, playing a low-down blues while half a dozen couples dance in a slow, almost hypnotic rhythm.)

sp.speaker: GROUP
sp.l: Da-doo-da. Da-doo-da.

div.l: Wa, wa, wa, wa. Da-doo-da. Da-doo-da.
div.stage: (Lights find another group on stage, in the center of which Clara sits with her baby in her arms, rocking it back and forth.)

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Summertime and the livin' is easy,
Fish are jumpin', and the cotton is high.
Oh your daddy's rich, and your ma is good lookin',
So hush, little baby, don' yo' cry.
One of these mornin's you goin' to rise up singin',
Then you'll spread yo' wings an' you'll take the sky.
But till that mornin', there's a-nothin' can harm you
With Daddy and Mammy standin' by.

div.stage: (Lights come up on still another group, this time a crap game.)

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Oh, nobody knows when the Lawd is goin' to call.

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: Roll dem bones, roll.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: It may be in the summertime and maybe in the fall.

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: Roll dem bones, roll.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: But you got to leave yo' baby and yo' home an' all,
So -

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, MEN
sp.l: Roll dem bones, oh, my brudder, oh my brudder,
Oh my brudder,
Roll dem bones, roll dem bones, roll, roll.

div.stage: (The stage grows lighter and Catfish Row takes up its normal life; children pass, couples walk about, the crap game continues.)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Seems like these bones don't give me
nothin' but boxcars tonight.
It was the same two weeks ago,
an' the game broke me;
I don't likes that kind o' luck!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.stage: (Sporting Life produces own dice, but Mingo grabs them)
sp.l: Damn you, give me dem bones!

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: What do you say to these, Jake?

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Them's the same cock-eyed bones
what clean the game out last Saturday night;
If they rolls in this game, I rolls out.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Honey boy!

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Come on down, Robbins, we're waiting for you.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Honey, don't play tonight. Do like I say.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: I been sweatin' all day.
Night time is man's time.
He got a right to forget his troubles.
He got a right to play.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: If you hadn't been drinkin' you wouldn't
talk to me that way.
You ain't nebber hear Lord Jesus say
nuttin' 'bout got to play.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: There you go again.
Lissen what I say.
I works all the week; Sunday got to pray.
But Saturday night a man's got a right to play.

sp.speaker: GROUP
sp.l: A man's got a right to play.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Yes, sir, that's right. That ole lady of mine is hell on
savin' money to join the buryin' lodge.
I says spend it while you is still alive and kickin'.

div.stage: (Picks up dice and throws with grunt.)

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: Lord, I is tired this night.
I'm done with cotton.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Better come along with me on the Sea Gull.
I got room for another fisherman.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: That suit me.
This cotton hook done swing its las' bale of cotton.
Here, who wants a cotton hook?

div.stage: (Throws cotton hook to center of floor; children dive for it; scramble.)

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Summertime and the livin' is easy.
Fish are jumping etc.

sp.speaker: CRAP SHOOTERS
sp.l: Seven come, seven come to pappy!
Throw that beautiful number!
Come seven to me! Yeah, man!
I'll bet yo' wrong.
I'll bet he's right! Gettin' hot!

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: ...Oh, yo' daddy's rich and yo' ma is good lookin'...

sp.speaker: CRAP SHOOTERS
sp.l: Come, seven! Shoot!
Made it! He made it!

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: So hush, little baby, don't yo' cry!

sp.speaker: CRAP SHOOTERS
sp.l: Ol' man seven come down from heaven!

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: What, that chile ain't asleep yet? Give him to me.
I'll fix him for you.
Lissen to yo' daddy warn you,
'Fore you start a-travelling,
Woman may born you, love you and mourn you,
But a woman is a sometime thing,
Yes, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Oh, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Yo' mammy is the first to name you,
Then she'll tie you to her apron string,
Then she'll shame you and she'll blame you
Till yo' woman comes to claim you,
'Cause a woman is a sometime
thing,
Yes, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Oh, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Don't you never let a woman grieve you
Jus' cause she got yo' weddin' ring.
She'll love you and deceive you,
Take yo' clothes and leave you
'Cause a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Yes, a woman is a sometime thing.
Yes, a woman is a sometime thing,
Yes, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: There now, what I tells you; he's asleep already.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: He got better sense than to listen to that nonsense.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Come back, Jake, you make a better crap shooter.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Here come de honey man.
Yes man, dis de honey man.
You got honey in de comb?
Yes man, I got honey in de comb.
An' is yo honey cheap?
Yes mam, my honey very cheap.
Here come de honey man.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Hello, Peter.

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: Well, here come my ol' man.
Now gimme the money! Now go sit and rest.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: You Scipio! Here come Porgy. Open the gate for him.

div.stage: (Scipio opens one side of iron gate. Porgy enters in goat cart; crowd greets him.)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Here's the ol' crap shark!

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Now we'll have a game!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Evenin' ladies, hello, boys!
Luck been ridin' high with Porgy today.
I got a pocket full of the Buckra money,
and it's goin' to any man what got the guts to shoot it off me.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Get on down, son we'll take it.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Lay it down.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: All right, mens, roll 'em.
We done wait long enough.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: You bes' wait for Crown. I see him comin',
takin' the whole sidewalk,
And he looks like he ain't gonna stand no foolin'.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Is Bess with him?

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Lissen to Porgy.
I think he's sof' on Crown's Bess.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I ain't nebber swap two words with Bess.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Porgy got too good sense
to look twice at that liquor guzzlin' slut.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: That gal Bess ain't fit for Gawd fearin'
ladies to 'sociate with.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Can't you keep yo' mouth off Bess.
Between Gawd fearin' ladies
and the Gawd damnin' men that gal ain't got a chance.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Ain' I tells you Porgy sof' on her?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: No, no, brudder, Porgy ain't sof' on no woman;
They pass by singin', they pass by cryin',
always lookin'.
They look in my do' an' they keep on movin'.
When Gawd make cripple,
He mean him to be lonely.
Night time, day time,
He got to trabble dat lonesome road.
Night time, day time,
He got to trabble dat lonesome road.

div.stage: (Crown shouts off stage, frightening children who scatter, yelling.)

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Here comes Big Boy!

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: 'Low, Crown.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: 'Low, Bess.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Hi, boys! All right, Sporting Life,
give us a pint and make it damn quick.
Pay him, Bess.

div.stage: (Sporting Life pulls out flask and hands it to Crown who takes long drink.)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Drunk again!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: He sure love his liquor, but some day
she's gonna throw him down.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: That damn whiskey'-jus' as weak as water.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: See that hussy drinkin' like any man!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Here, Robbins, have one to the Gawd fearin' ladies.
There's nothin' like 'em, thank Gawd.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Oh, no, you don't.
Nobody ain't drinkin' none of my licker.
All right, mens, I'm talkin' to you.
Anybody answerin' me?

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Boxcars again.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Cover 'em, brother, cover 'em.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Cover hell! I goin' to pass 'em along
and see if I can break my luck.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Robbins' lady ain't allow him but
fifty cent and he can't take no chances with bad luck.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: That's all right, honey boy,
I'll stake you when yo' four bits done gone.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Go ahead an' play.
You don't need no charity off no she-devils.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: See what I gets for you.
Yo' woman is easy when you know the way.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Crapped out!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Don't you ever let a woman grieve you.

sp.speaker: PORGY, ALL
sp.l: She'll love you and deceive you,
take yo' clothes and leave you
'Cause--

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: A woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Yes, a woman is a sometime thing.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: That gal ain't need to worry 'bout
no man marryin' her.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Some women got to marry a man to keep him.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Shut yo' damn mouth!
You don't give Mingo a chance to talk to the bones.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Fade me.
Old snake-eye go off an' die.
Old man seven come down from heaven.
Seven!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: I ain't seen that seven yet.
You done turn 'em over.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: What I throw?

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Seven.
Seven.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: He throw seven.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Well there's more than one big mouth done meet his
Gawd for pullin' 'em in before I reads 'em see!
An' I'm sayin' it over tonight.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Yo' mammy's gone and yo' daddy's happy
Come home little bones, come home to pappy.
Four to make. Come four!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Crapped out!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: I shoots like that.
Come clean you little blackeyed bitches.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Six! Six!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Six to make!

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Six to make!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Kiss rabbit foot and show these tinhorns how to hit.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Crapped out, come to your pappy.

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Crown too cock-eyed drunk to read 'em.
What the dice say, Bess?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Seven.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: I ain't drunk enough to read 'em.
That is the trouble. Ha ha, ha ha, ha ha!
Licker ain't strong enough.
Give me a pinch of happy dust, Sportin' Life.

div.stage: (Sporting Life produces small paper from hat band.)

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Don't give him that stuff, Sportin' Life.
He's ugly drunk already.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Pay him an' shut up.

div.stage: (Takes paper from Sporting Life and inhales. Bess pays Sporting Life.)

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Frien' an' dice an' happy dust
ain't meant to 'sociate...
You mens bes' go slow.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Leave Peter be, let him alone.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: He ain't mean no harm.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Huh, seven! Huh, seven! Huh, seven!
'Leven come home, Fido!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: God damn it, I ain't read 'em yet.

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: Crown cockeyed drunk,
he can't tell dice from a watermelon;
Crown cockeyed drunk,
he can't tell dice from wa--

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Shut up!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Six to make!

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: Seven!

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Crapped out!

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Seven, Seven!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, little stars, little stars,
Roll, roll, roll me some light,
'Leven little stars, come home, come home,
Roll dis poor beggar a sun an' a moon,
a sun an' a moon.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Li'l Joe.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: Little Joe.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, no, my brother, that ain't little Joe.
They is the monin' and the evenin' stars.
An' just you watch 'em rise and shine for
this poor beggar.
Turn me loose.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: Made 'em!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Roll up that bastard's sleeve.
sp.stage: (Porgy pulls in pot, laughs, rolls up sleeve.)
sp.l: Well, you got them damn dice, conjer them.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Boy, boy, boy, I'm a crap shootin' idiot.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, JAKE
sp.l: Crapped out!

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Rolled out!

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Nine to make, come nine!

div.stage: (Sweeps up money, Crown seizes his wrist.)

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Touch that money an' meet yo' Gawd!

sp.speaker: ROBBINS
sp.l: Take yo' hand off me, you lousy houn'.
Han' me that brick behin' you.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Nobody's gettin' away with Crown's money.
I'm goin' kill dat bastard!

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Looks like trouble to me;
He made his nine, he made his nine.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: There's gonna be a fight, look out!
Hold him back, Somebody hold them back,
Crown got murder in his eye!
Somebody hold them back!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Crown's drunk, Robbins bes' take care, take care,
Robbins take care. Look out Robbins!

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: Dat's right.
Some one will sure get hurt.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Robbins ain't got a chance wid Crown,
he's too big.

div.stage: (Crown and Robbins fight fiercely as crowd holds Serena back.)

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Oh, stop them! Don't let them fight!
I warned him, oh! Won't somebody stop them,
Won't somebody stop them now!
Oh, stop them! etc.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Someone will surely get hurt, so stop,
won't somebody stop them!
Come on Crown, stop it. Oh! I'm so afraid!
I'm so afraid! Stop Crown!
Stop dem, make 'em cut it out!

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Ain't you men got better sense?
Such fools! Liquor always make trouble;
better put a stop to this fighting, it's awful, it's simply awful!
Someone stop the fight, he will surely kill dat man!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Crown is drunk, there's goin' to be some trouble.
Robbins, take care!
Oh, Lawd have mercy an' don' let Crown hurt Robbins!
This is de worst fight yet.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Look out, be careful!
Someone is gonna get hurt!
He'll kill 'im! He'll kill 'im! Crown's had too much
Crown is like a debbil when he's drinkin' like a fool.
Stop!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Crown cock-eyed drunk, he don' know what he's doin'.
Yes sir, Crown has had a little but too much.
Crown's had too much, Crown is like a debbil etc.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: This looks like a real fight, Robbins done for.
Oh, Crown is actin very bad, bad, bad.
Come on, let's stop dem now, come on, let's stop dem!
Dis Crown is like a debbil etc.

sp.speaker: WOMEN
sp.l: Oh, stop them, someone will get hurt!
Why must people fight?
Crown is a bad, bad bizness when he's drunk!
Why mus' they fight, won' somebody
please goin' an' stop dem now!

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: Crown is drunk! Robbins got no chance,
oh Robbins got no chance!
Crown is a bad, bad bizness when he's drunk!
Something mighty bad is boun' to happen!
Hold dem back! Won't some one hol' dem back
some one hol'dem back!

div.stage: (Crown throws Robbins down. They fight fiercely; Crown jerks out his cotton hook.)

sp.speaker: WOMEN
sp.l: Can't anybody make Crown stop,
Can't anybody make Crown stop?
Lawd, please make dem stop!

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: Robbins is gone, Yes, suh!
He's got no chance! No suh!
Lawd, please make dem stop!
sp.stage: (Suddenly Crown stabs Robbins with cotton hook. Robbins falls dead. Serena screams.)

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Jesus, he killed him!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Wake up an' hit it out.
You ain't got no time to lose.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: What the matter?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You done kill Robbins and the police will be comin'.

div.stage: (She shakes him to his senses. The entire crowd disperses in various directions.)

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Where you goin' hide?
They know you an' I pulls together.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Some man always willin' to take care of Bess.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Well, get this: whoever he is, he's temporary.
I'm comin' back when the hell dies down.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: All right, only get out now. Here, take this.
sp.stage: (She takes money from stocking and gives it to him. He disappears. Bess runs senses Sporting Life behind her.)
sp.l: That you, Sportin' Life?

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Sure, and I's the only friend you got left.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: For Gawd's sake, give me a touch of happy dust.
I shakin' so I can hardly stand.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Listen, I'll be goin' to New York soon.
I'll hide you out and take you with me.
Why you an' me will make a swell team.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I ain't come to that yet.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Well, the cops ain't goin' find me here
for no woman.

div.stage: (Slinks out. Bess looks for shelter, knocks at doors. They are locked or slammed in her face.)

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: You done bring trouble enough,
get out before the police come.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You wouldn't have a heart and let me in?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Not till hell freeze!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Who live over there?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: That's Porgy, he ain't no use to your kind,
he's a cripple and a beggar.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Come on, Please let me in!

div.stage: (Bess moves toward the gate. As she reaches it, police whistle sends her back. She turns back, frightened. Porgy's door opens. Porgy stretches out hand to her. Shuddering away from Serena and the body, she goes to Porgy's door. Porgy reaches for Bess' hand. She enters his room.)

div.head: Scene 2
div.stage: (Serena's Room. Robbins's body lies on the bed, a saucer on his chest. The room is filled with mourners who drop money in the saucer)

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Where is brudder Robbins?

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: He's a-gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: I seen him in de mornin' wid his work clo'es on

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: But he's gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.

sp.speaker: MAN
sp.l: An' I seen him in the noontime straight and tall,
But death acome awalkin' in the evenin' fall

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: An' he's gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: An' death touched Robbins wid a silver knife

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: An' he's gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.

sp.speaker: MAN
sp.l: An' he's sittin' in de garden by de tree of life.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: An' he's gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.
Robbins is gone, gone, gone, etc.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Who's dat acomin' climbin' up my steps?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: It's Porgy, an' Bess is ahelpin' him.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: What's dat woman comin' here for?

div.stage: (Porgy and Bess enter. Bess advances toward bier, money in hand.)

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: I don't need yo' money for to bury my man.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Dis ain't Crown's money.
Porgy give me my money now.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: All right, then.
You can put it in the saucer.

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Come on, sister, come on, brudder,
Fill up the saucer till it overflow,

sp.speaker: GROUP
sp.l: Overflow, overflow.
Fill up de saucer till it overflow.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Yes, my Jesus, overflow.

sp.speaker: FIRST WOMAN
sp.l: 'Cause de Lawd will meet you,
Yes, de Lawd will meet you at the courthouse do'-

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Court-house do', court-house do',
De Lawd will meet you at the court-house do'.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Yes, my Jesus, court-house do'.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: How de saucer stand now, my sister?

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Oh, he's gone, gone, gone, etc.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Fourteen dollars an' fifty cent.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Dat's a-comin' on, sister, you can bury him soon.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: What am I goin' to do if I ain' got the money?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Gawd got plenty of money for de saucer.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Bless de Lord!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' he goin' to soffen dese people heart for
to fill de saucer till he spill all over.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Amen, my Jesus!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: De Lawd will provide a grave for his chillen.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Bless the Lord!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' he got comfort for de widder.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Oh, my Jesus!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' he goin' feed his fadderless chillen.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Yes Lawd, Truth Lawd!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' he goin' raise dis poor sinner up out of de grave.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Allelujah!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' set him in de shinin' seat ob de righteous.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Amen, my Jesus!

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Overflow, overflow,
Oh fill up de saucer till it overflow,
Everybody helpin' now - sendin' our brudder to heaven,
Lawd, Oh Lawd, send down your angels!
Robbins is rising to heaven!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, sufferin' Jesus!
You knows right from wrong.
You knows Robbins was a good man,
an' now he's weary an' he's goin' home.
Reach down yo' lovin han' an' take our
brudder to yo' bosom.
Thank you, Lawd, Bless you Lawd.
Lawd will fill de saucer, over, overflow, Oh!

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Overflow, overflow, Oh Lawd will fill de saucer,
Ev'rybody helpin' now etc.
Robbins is risin' to heaven! etc. -till it overflow, Oh!

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Um! A saucer-burial setup, I see.
You're his widow?

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Yes, suh.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: He did not leave any burial insurance?

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: No, boss, he didn't leave nuttin'.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Well, see to it he's buried tomorrow.
You killed Robbins an' I'm going to hang you for it!

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: He ain't don um!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: What he say?

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: He say you kill Robbins.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Come along now!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: 'Fore Gawd, boss, I ain't never done um!

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Who did it, then?
You heard me, who did it?

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Crown done it, boss. I done see him do it.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: You're sure you saw him?

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I swear to Gawd, boss,
I was right there beside him.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: That's easy. I thought as much.
You. You saw it too.
I don't want to have to put the law on you.
Look at me, you damn dummy!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I don't know nuttin' 'bout it, boss.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: That's your room in the corner, ain't it?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Yes, boss, dat's my room.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: The door opens on the court, don't it?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Yes, boss, my door opens on the court.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: An' yet you didn't see or hear anything?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I don't know nuttin' 'bout it, boss. I been asleep inside,
and my door been closed.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: You're a damn liar.
He saw the killing;
take him along and lock him up as a material witness.

sp.speaker: POLICEMAN
sp.l: Come along, uncle.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I ain't done it, boss.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: How long you goin' lock him up for?

sp.speaker: POLICEMAN
sp.l: Till we catch Crown.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I reckon Crown done loose now in de palmetto thickets,
an' dere ain' no rope long enough to hang him.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Then the old man's out of luck.
Remember, you've got to bury that body tomorrow
or the board of health will take him an' turn him over to the medical students.
Come on, get the old man in the wagon.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I ain't never done nuttin', boss.
I swear to Gawd I ain' never done nuttin'.

div.stage: (The sound of the wagon's bell fades away in the distance.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I can't puzzle this thing out. Peter was a good man,
but dat lousy Crown was a killer and forever gettin' into trouble.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: That's the truth, brother.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: And there go Peter to be lock up like a thief.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Like a thief.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: An' here be Robbins with his wife
and his fadderless chillen, an' Crown done gone his ways drinkin', gamblin', swearin', to do the same thing over and over somewheres else.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: My man's gone now,
Ain't no use alistenin'
For his tired foot-steps
Climbin' up de stairs. Ah!
Ole Man Sorrow
Come to keep me comp'ny,
Whisperin' beside me
When I say my prayers. Ah-
Ain't dat I min' workin'·
Work an' me is travellers
Journeyin' togedder
To de promise land.
But Ole Man Sorrow's
Marchin' all de way wid me
Tellin' me I'm ole now
Since I lose my man.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Since she lose her man.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Since I lose my man.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Ah!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Ole Man Sorrow sittin' by de fireplace,
lyin' all night long by me in de bed.
Tellin' me de same thing mornin', noon an' eb'nin'.
That I'm all alone now since my man is dead.
Ah! Since my man is dead!

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Ah!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Ah!

sp.speaker: UNDERTAKER
sp.l: How de saucer stan' now, my sister?

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: There ain't but fifteen dollar.

sp.speaker: UNDERTAKER
sp.l: Hum! Can't bury him for fifteen dollar.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: He got to be buried tomorrow or the board of health
will take him and give him to the medical students.

sp.speaker: UNDERTAKER
sp.l: Life is hard, brudder, but we all got to live.
It cos' money for to bury a grown man.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Oh, for Gawd sake,
bury him in the grave yard...
Don't let the students take him
to cut up an' scatter.
I goin' to work on Monday, an' I swear to Gawd,
I goin' pay you ev'ry cent.

sp.speaker: UNDERTAKER
sp.l: All right, sister,
wit the box an' one carriage, it'll cos' me more'n twenty-five, but I'll see you through.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Jesus bless you, my brudder.

sp.speaker: UNDERTAKER
sp.l: You can all be ready tomorrow mornin'.
It's a long trip to the cemetery.

sp.speaker: GROUP
sp.l: Oh, he's gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, the train is at the station
An' you better get on board
'Cause it's leavin' today.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Leavin' today, leavin' today.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, the train is at the station
An' you better get on board,
'Cause it's leavin' today, 'An it's headin' for The Promise Lan'.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Headin' for the Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, we're leavin' for the Promise Lan'
Leavin' for the Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: BESS, ALL
sp.l: Keep that drivin' wheel arollin', rollin' Let it roll...
Until we meet our brudder in the Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, I got my ticket ready
an' de time is gettin' short 'Cause we're leavin' today.

sp.speaker: BESS, ALL
sp.l: Leavin' today, leavin' today.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, I got my ticket ready
an' de time is gettin' short 'Cause we're leavin' today, an' we're headed for the Promise Lan'.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: ...headed for the Promise Lan'

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, we're leavin' for the Promise Lan'
Leavin' for the Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: BESS, ALL
sp.l: Keep that drivin' wheel arollin', rollin` Let it roll...
Until we meet our brudder in the Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Oh, we're leavin' for the Promise' Lan'
an' you better get on board all you sinners, oh, you better get on board.
'Cause we're leavin' etc...
'Cause we're leavin' for the Lan', Oh!
Keep that drivin' wheel arollin', rollin' 'til
we meet our brudder in the Promise' Lan'.

div.head: Scene 1
div.stage: (Jake and fishermen repair netting, swaying to the rhythm of a rowing song.)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Oh, I'm agoin' out to the Blackfish banks
No matter what de wedder say,
An' when I say I'm goin' I means goin'
An' I'm leavin' at de break o' day.

sp.speaker: JAKE, MEN
sp.l: It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there,
But I'll anchor in the Promise' Lan'
In de Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: An' Lawdy, if I meet Mister Hurricane
an' Hurricane tell me no
I'll take ole Mister Hurricane by the pants
an' I'll throw him in de jailhouse do'.

sp.speaker: JAKE, MEN
sp.l: It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there,
But I'll anchor in the Promise' Lan'.
In de Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: I got a blister on my settin' down place,
I got a blister in my han',
But I'm goin' row dis little boat, trust me Gawd,
Till I anchor in de Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: JAKE, MEN
sp.l: It takes a long pull to get there, huh!
It takes a long pull to get there, huh!
It takes a long pull to get there,
But I'll anchor in de Promise' Lan'.

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: Mus' be you mens forgot about de picnic.
Ain' you knows dat de p'rade start up
de block at ten o'clock?

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: That's right, mens.
Turn out tomorrow mornin'
an' we'll push de Seagull clean to de Blackfish banks 'fore we wet de anchor.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Jake, you ain't plannin' to take de Seagull
to de Blackfish banks, is you?
It's time for de September storms.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: How you think dat boy goin' get de college education,
if I don' work hard an' make money?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, I got plenty o' nuttin',
An' nuttin's plenty fo' me.
I got no car, got no mule, I got no misery.
De folks wid plenty o' plenty
Got a lock on dey door.
'Fraid somebody's agoin' to rob 'em
While dey's out amakin' more.
What for?
I got no lock on de door,
- Dat's no way to be -
Dey can steal de rug from de floor.
Dat's okeh wid me,
'Cause de things dat I prize
Like de stars in de skies
All are free.
Oh, I got plenty o' nuttin',
An' nuttin's plenty fo' me,
I got my gal, got my song,
Got Hebben de whole day long!
No use complainin'!
Got my gal, got my Lawd, got my song.

sp.speaker: WOMEN
sp.l: Porgy change since dat woman
come to live with he.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: How he change!

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: He ain't cross with chillen no more,
an' ain't you hear how he an' Bess all de time singin' in their room?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: I tells you dat cripple's happy now.

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Happy.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I got plenty o'nuttin',
An' nuttin's plenty fo' me.
I got de sun, got de moon,
got de deep blue sea.
De folks wid plenty o' plenty,
Got to pray all de day.
Seems wid plenty you sure got to worry
How to keep de debble away, away.
I ain't afrettin' 'bout hell
Till de time arrive.
Never worry long as I'm well,
Never one to strive to be good, to be bad,
What de hell, I is glad I's alive.
Oh, I got plenty o' nuttin'
An' nuttin's plenty fo' me.
I got my gal, got my song,
Got Hebben de whole day long.
No use complainin',
Got my gal, got my Lawd, got my song!

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Got his gal, got his Lawd.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Lissen there, what I tells you.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Go 'long with you, dat woman ain't de kin'
for to make a cripple happy.
It take a killer like Crown to hol' her down.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.stage: (Maria seizes his hand and blows white powder from his palm.)
sp.l: What you t'ink you doin'?
Dat stuff cos' money.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Lissen here, I ain' say nuttin',
no matter how drunk you get dese boys
roun' here on rotgut whiskey,
but nobody ain' goin peddle happy dust 'roun' my shop.
Does you hear what I say?

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Oh, come on now, ole lady,
le's you an' me be fren'.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.stage: (grabs Sporting Life by the throat and picks up carving knife)
sp.l: Frien' wid you low-life, hell, no!
I hates yo' struttin' style,
Yes sir, and yo' god damn silly smile
an' yo' ten cent di'mons an' yo' fi'cent butts.
Oh, I hates yo' guts.
Somebody's got to carve you up
to set these people free
An' de writin' on the wall says
it's a goin' to be me.
Some night when you is full of gin
an'don't know I's about,
I'm goin' to take you by de tail
an' turn you inside out.
Frien wid you, low-life! hell, no!

sp.speaker: MARIA, CROWD
sp.l: Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha!
I's figgerin to break yo' bones
Yes sir, one by one.
An' then I's goin' to carve you up
an' hang you in de sun.
I'll feed yo' meat to buzzards
an' give'em belly aches.
An' take yo' bones to Kittiwah
to pizen rattlesnakes,
Frien's wid you, low-life?
I fears I mus' decline!
I sooner cuts mah own throat 'fore
I calls you a frien' of mine!

div.stage: (Sporting Life runs off. Lawyer Frazier enters. Maria sees him and follows after him.)

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Mornin', Lawyer, lookin' for somebody?

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Porgy live here, don't he?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: He sho' do, right over there's his room.
Here, Porgy, here's Lawyer Frazier to see you.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Mornin', Porgy.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Mornin', Lawyer.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Ain't that Crown's Bess in yo' room?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: No, sir, she ain't, she's Porgy's Bess.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Ah ha, ah ha, Porgy's Bess, eh?
Den I guess she'll be wantin' divorce.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Huh?

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Ef de woman livin' wid you now,
she got to have divorce from Crown or else it ain't legal.

div.stage: (Takes doccument and shows it to Porgy.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: How much dat t'ing cost?

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: One dollar. Dat is, if there ain' no complication.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Bess, you likes to have divorce?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: What you think, Porgy?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I'm agoin' to buy you a divorce.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Wait a minute, it ain't legal yet.
Yo' name?

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Bess!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Yo' age?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Twenty year.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Lord, Lord, listen what she say.
Dat girl's thirty if she's a day!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: You desire to be divorce from dat man Crown?

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Sho' she do, sho' she do,
Yes suh, yes suh, sho' she do!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: I'm askin' you.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Yes, boss, dat's true.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Address the court a "Yo' honor."

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Yes, yo' honor. Yes, yo' honor.
Yes, yo' honor. Yes, yo' honor.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: When was you an' Crown marry?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I don't rightly remember, yo' honor.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: One yeah, five yeah, ten yeah, what?

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: Dat gal ain' never marry!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Ah, dat's a complication!

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Dat's a complication.
Dat's a complication, Lord, Lord.
ONE MAN
Dat is a complication.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: You can't sell her divorce, gimme back my dollah!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: 'Course I sells divorce.
You got no right to laugh, but it take expert
to divorce woman what ain't marry,
an' it cos' you, ahem, a dollar an' a half.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Don't pay him, Porgy. Don't let him take you in.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: All right, go on livin' in sin.
sp.stage: (Porgy counts out money and gives it to Frazier, who signs and seals paper and hands it to Bess.)
sp.l: Good day to you, Missis Porgy.
Only dollar an' a half
to change from woman to lady.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Woman to lady, woman to lady, Lord,
Lord, woman to lady!
SCIPIO
Dey's a Buckra comin'.

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: What he say?

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: W'ite gen'man.
ARCHDALE
Boy. Come here, boy!
I'm looking for a man by the name of Porgy.
Which is his room?
Come, don't you know Porgy?
SCIPIO
No, suh.
ARCHDALE
I'm looking for a man named Porgy;
Can you direct me to his room?

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Anybody here know a man name Porgy?

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: Come. I'm a friend of his, Mister Archdale
I have good news for him.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Go long and wake Porgy.
Can't you tell folks when you see em?

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Oh you mean Porgy!
I ain' understan' what name you say.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Oh, de gen'man mean Porgy.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Dat's him, boss, dat's ole Porgy.
Glad to serve you boss.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Wake up Porgy, a gen'man come to see you.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: How you does, boss?

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: Good morning.
I've come to tell you about your friend, Peter,
who got locked up on account of the Robbins murder.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: How you come to care, boss?

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: His folks used to belong to my fam'ly
and I just heard he was in trouble.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: He sho' got plenty of trouble.

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: Well, you can tell all of Peter's friends
I'll go his bond.
He'll soon be back home again.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Thank you, boss.
Gawd bless you, boss, bless you, bless you!

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Good mornin' Mister Archdale.

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: Good morning Frazier, hope you're not
selling any more divorces.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: He jus' made a lady out of Bess for a dollar an' a half.

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: I, Simon Frazier, hereby divorce Bess an Crown,
for the charge of one dollar an' fifty cents cash,
signed Simon Frazier...
Look here, Frazier, this divorce
mill must close or I'll have to put you in jail.
I won't report you this time.
Good morning.

sp.speaker: FRAZIER
sp.l: Gawd bless you, boss. Gawd bless you.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Good mornin', Mister Archdale.

div.stage: (At this point a great bird flies low, frightening evervbody.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Look out, dat's a buzzard!

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Drive um off, don't let um light,
chase away dat buzzard'

sp.speaker: ARCHDALE
sp.l: What is it, what's the matter?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Boss, dat bird mean trouble.
Once de buzzard fold his wing an' light over yo' house,
all yo' happiness done dead.
Buzzard keep on flyin' over, take along yo' shadow.
Ain' nobody dead dis mornin'
Livin's jus' begun.
Two is strong where one is feeble;
man an' woman livin', workin',
Sharin' grief an' sharin' laughter,
An' love like Augus' sun.
Trouble, is dat you over yonder
lookin' lean an' hungry?
Don' you let dat buzzard keep you
hangin' round my do'.
Ain' you heard de news this mornin'?
Step out, brudder, hit de gravel;
Porgy who you used to feed on,
Don' live here no mo'
Ha, ha, ha, ha! Buzzard, on yo' way!
Ole age, what is you anyhow,
nuttin' but bein' lonely.
Pack yo' things an' fly from here,
Carry grief an' pain.
Dere's two folks livin' in dis shelter
Eatin', sleepin', singin', prayin'.
Ain' no such thing as loneliness.
An' Porgy's young again.

sp.speaker: PORGY, CHORUS
sp.l: Buzzard, keep on flyin',
Porgy's young again.

div.stage: (All move off to their various rooms, leaving Bess alone. Sporting Life enters, sneaks up to Bess.)

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: 'Lo, Bess, goin' to picnic?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: No, guess I'll stay home.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Picnics is all right for these small town suckers,
but we is use to the high life, you know.
You an' me, we understands each other.
I can't see for the life of me
what you is hangin' roun' this place for;
why, with your looks, Bess,
an' your way with the boys,
there's big money for you,
an' me in New York.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I can't remember ever meetin' a nothin'
what I likes less than I does you.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Oh, come on, now, how about a little touch
of happy dus' for old time sake?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I's through with that stuff!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Come on, give me yo' han'.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I tells you, I's through!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Just a pinch, not enough to hurt a flea.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: No, no, I done give up dope.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Tell that to somebody else,
nobody ever gave up happy dus'.
sp.stage: (Porgy reaches out and seizes Sporting Life's wrist.)
sp.l: Leggo, you dam' cripple!
Gawd, what a grip for a piece of a man!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Sportin' Life, you keep away from my woman,
or I'll break yo' damn neck!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: I'd like to see a lousy cripple,
like you, break my neck.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: If I get my hands on you once more,
you'll see quick enough.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Go 'long now.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: All right, yo' men frien's come an' they go,
but remember ole Sportin' Life
an' de happy dus' here all along.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Get out, you rat, you louse, you buzzard!

div.stage: (Sporting Life scuttles off. Jake and Clara come out dressed for the picnic.)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Honey, we sure goin' strut our stuff today.

div.l: Be sure to come 'long to de picnic, Bess.
div.stage: (They leave. Bess and Porgy are left alone.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Bess, you is my woman now, you is, you is!
An' you mus' laugh an' sing an' dance
for two instead of one.
Want no wrinkle on yo' brow, no-how.
Because de sorrow of de past is all done done.
Oh, Bess, my Bess,
De real happiness is jes' begun.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Porgy, I's yo' woman now, I is, I is!
An' I ain' never goin' nowhere 'less you shares de fun.
Dere's no wrinkle on my brow, no how,
But I ain' goin'! You hear me sayin',
If you ain' goin', wid you I'm stayin'.
Porgy, I's yo' woman now, I's yours forever
Mornin' time an' evenin time
an summer time an' winter time.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Mornin' time an' evenin' time an summer
time an' winter time, Bess, you got yo' man.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Porgy, I's yo woman now, I is, I is!
An' I ain' never goin' nowhere
'Less you shares de fun.
Dere's no wrinkle on my brow, no how
But I ain' goin'! You hear me sayin',
If you ain' goin', wid you I'm stayin'.
Porgy, I's yo woman now! I's yours forever.
Mornin' time an' evenin' time an' summer time an' winter time,
hmmmmmm.
Oh, my Porgy, my man Porgy,
From dis minute I'm tellin' you, I keep dis vow;
Porgy, I's yo' woman now.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Bess, you is my woman now an' forever.
Dis life is jes' begun.
Bess, we two is one now an' forever.
Oh, Bess, don' min' dose women.
You got yo' Porgy, you loves yo' Porgy
I knows you means it, I seen it in yo' eyes, Bess.
We'll go swingin' through de years asingin'
Hmmm...Mornin' time an' evenin' time
an' summer time an' winter time.
My Bess, my Bess, from dis minute I'm tellin' you,
I keep dis vow;
Oh, my Bessie, we's happy now,
We is one now.

div.stage: (Catfish Row crowd comes out attired in their lodge regalia, singing and dancing, ready for the picnic.)

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Oh, I can't sit down.
Got to keep agoin' like de flowin' of a song.
Oh, I can't sit down
Guess I'll take my honey an' her sunny smile along.
Today I is gay an' I's free
Jes' abubblin', nothin'troublin' me.
Oh, I's gwine to town
I can't sit down.
Happy feelin', in my bones astealin'
No concealin' dat it's picnic day.
Sho's is dandy, got de licker handy.
Me an' Mandy, we is on de way
'Cause dis is picnic day.
Oh I can't sit down
Got to keep ajumpin' to de thumpin' of de drum!
Oh, I can't sit down.
Full of locomotion like an ocean full of rum!
Today I is gay an' I's free.
Jes' abubblin', nothin' troublin' me!
Oh, I's gwine to town
I can't, jes' can't, sit down!

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: What's de matter wid you, sister?
Ain't you know you goin' be late for de picnic?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I stayin' with Porgy.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Sho' you goin'. Ev'rybody goin'.
You got to help me wid my
basket. Come now, where's yo' hat?
What's dis talk about stayin' home
when ev'rybody goin' to de picnic?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Porgy, I hates to go an' leave you all alone.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Bess, my honey, I so glad to have you go,
I been wantin' you to be so happy here in Catfish Row.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Yes, Porgy, I know.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Go, chile, go.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Come on, chile! Get into dese clo'es.
You stay roun' here an' you'll die of de lonesome blues.
Come on now, hurry up. We'll be late for dat boat.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Goodbye, Porgy.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Goodbye, honey.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Goodbye, Porgy goodbye.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, I got plenty o' nuttin',
An' nuttin's plenty fo' me,
I got my gal, got my Lawd,
got Hebben de whole day long.
Got my gal, got my Lawd, got my song!

div.head: Scene 2
div.stage: (General gaiety-all well-fed-some few, well-liquored. Some dancing.)

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: I ain' got no shame doin' what I like to do!
I ain' got no shame doin' what I like to do!
Sun ain' got no shame; moon ain' got no shame.
So I ain' got no shame, doin' what I like to do!!
So I ain' got no shame, doin' what I like to do!!
Ha da da, Ha da da, etc.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: It ain't necessarily so.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: It ain't necessarily so.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: De t'ings dat yo' li'ble
To read in de Bible,
It ain't necessarily so.
Li'l David was small, but oh my!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Li'I David was small, but oh my!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: He fought big Goliath
Who lay down an' dieth,
Li'l David was small, but oh my!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Wadoo-Zim bam boodle-oo,
Hoodle ah da wa da - Scatty wah.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Yeah! Oh, Jonah, he lived in de whale.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Oh, Jonah, he lived in de whale.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Fo' he made his home in
Dat fish's abdomen.
Oh, Jonah, he lived in de whale.
Li'l Moses was found in a stream.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Li'l Moses was found in a stream.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: He floated on water
Till Ole Pharaoh's daughter
She fished him, she says, from dat stream.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Wa-dooZim bam boodle-oo,
Hoodle ah da wa - Scatty wah.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Yeah! It ain't necessarily so.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: It ain't necessarily so.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Dey tell all you chillun
De debble's a villun
But 'tain't necessarily so.
To get into Hebben,
Don' snap for a sebben!
Live clean. Look at me!
Don' have no fault.
Oh, I takes dat gospel
Whenever it's pos'ble,
But wid a grain of salt.
Methus'lah lived nine hundred years.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Methus'lah lived nine hundred years.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Say, but who calls dat livin'
When no gal'll give in
To no man what's nine hundred years?
I'm preachin' dis sermon to show
It ain't nessa, ain't nessa, ain't nessa, ain't nessa.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE, CHORUS
sp.l: Ain't necessarily so.
I'm preachin' dis sermon to show
It ain't nessa, ain't nessa, ain't nessa, ain't nessa
Ain't necessarily so.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Shame on all you sinners.
You call yourselves Church-members,
you goes on a decent picnic of
The Sons an' Daughters of Repent Ye Saith the Lord.
An' when the Christians turn their back
you start behavin' like Sodom an' Gomorrah.
It's a Gawd's wonder de Lord don't sen' His livin' fire
to burn you offen de face of de earth.
An you, Jake, always so loudmouth at church-meeting,
Tell me when did you start workin' for de devil?
Take them baskets an' get on de boat.
all you wicked chillen of de devil!
Hear what I tell you, It's high time you was goin'.
You bes' hurry up, you goin' miss dat boat.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: If dat boat go without me,
there's gonna be some blue lightning in Catfish Row when I gets home.
Hey there! Hold yo' holt. I's acomin!
Hurry up, Bess! Dat boat's gettin' de whoopin' cough.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Bess!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Crown!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You know very well dis Crown.
I seen you lan' an' I been
waitin' all day for see you.
I mos' dead on this damn island.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You ain' looks mos' dead, you bigger'n ever.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Oh, I got plenty to eat, bird egg, oyster an' such.
But I mos' dead of the lonesome
wid not one Gawd'person to swap a word wid.
Lord! I's glad you come.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I can't stay, Crown,
or de boat'll go without me.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Damn dat boat! Got any happy dus' wid you?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: No, Crown, no mo' happy dus'.
I done give up dope, an' besides, Crown,
I got something for to tell you.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You bes'lissen to what I gots to tell you.
I waitin' here till de cotton begin comin' in.
Den libbin 'll be easy.
Johnny'll hide you an' me
on de ribber boat fur as Savannah.
Who you libbin' wid now?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I livin' wid de cripple Porgy.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha.
You sho'got funny tas' in men, but dat's yo' business.
I ain' care who you takes up wid while I's away.
But membuh, what I tol' you. He's temporary.
I reckon it'll be just a couple ob weeks now 'fore
I comes for you.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Crown, I got something to tell you.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: What dat?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I... I livin' wid Porgy now, an' I livin' decent.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You hear what I tol' you,
I say in a couple ob weeks I's comin' for you,
an' you is goin' tote fair,
lessen you wants to meet yo' Gawd you gets dat?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Take yo' han's off me,
I goin' miss dat boat.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You tellin' me dat you'd rather have dat cripple
dan Crown?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: It's like dis, Crown, I's the only woman
Porgy ever had,
an' I's thinkin' now,
how it will be tonight when
all these others gets 'em go back to Catfish Row.
He'll be sittin' an' watchin' the big front gate,
acountin' 'em off, waitin' for Bess.
An' when the las' woman goes home to her man
an' I ain' there...
Lemme go, Crown!
You can get plenty other women.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: What I wants wid other woman?
I gots a woman an' dat's you, see!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh... What you want wid Bess?
She's gettin' ole now;
Take a fine young gal
For to satisfy Crown.
Look at this chest
An' look at these arms you got.
You know how it always been with me,
These five years I been yo' woman,
You could kick me in the street,
Then when you wanted me back,
You could whistle, an' there I was
Back again, lickin' yo' hand.
There's plenty better lookin' gal than Bess.
Can' you see, I'm with Porgy,
Now and forever
I am his woman, he would die without me.
Oh, Crown, won't you let me go to my man, to my man.
He is a cripple an' needs my love, all my love.
What you want wid Bess? Oh, let me go to my man...

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: What I wants wid other woman,
I gots a woman, yes,
An' dat is you, yes, dat is you, yes,
I need you now an' you're mine
jus' as long as I want you.
No cripple goin' take my woman from me.
You got a man tonight an' that is Crown,
yes, Crown, yes Crown.
You're my woman, Bess, I'm tellin' you,
now I'm your man.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: What you want with Bess?
Lemme go, Crown dat boat, it's goin' without me!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You ain't goin' nowhere!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Take yo' hands off me,
I say, yo' hands, yo' hands, yo hands.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: I knows you' ain' change - wid you and me
it always be the same. Git in dat thicket.

div.head: Scene 3
div.stage: (The court before dawn. Bells herald the new day. Fishermen loll about sleepily)

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Honey, dat's all de breakfast I got time for.
It's gettin' late, the weather's fine.
I'm on my way.
Come on, you fishermens, it's time to trabble.

sp.speaker: NELSON
sp.l: All right, Jake.

sp.speaker: JIM
sp.l: All ready, Jake, we bes' be off.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Goodbye, boys.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Goodbye, Maria.

sp.speaker: NELSON
sp.l: It looks to me like it goin' storm today.

sp.speaker: JAKE
sp.l: Don't you know dat ain' de way to talk 'fore my woman.
So long, Clara, gangway for de Sea Gull.

sp.speaker: JAKE, MEN
sp.l: It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there, huh!
It take a long pull to get there, but
I'll anchor in de Promise' Lan'
In de Promise' Lan'.

div.stage: (Group continues singing as they go off.)

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Take yo' han's off me, I say.
Yo' han's, yo' han's, yo' han's!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: She still out of her head.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Eighteen mile to Kittiwah, eighteen mile to trabble,
Lord, what a long road, ain' nobody to help me.
Ain' nobody to help me!

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Well, if it ain' ole Peter!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: De white folks put me in
an' de white folks take me out an' I ain'
know yet what I done, what I done, done, done...

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, there's a rattlesnake in dem bushes
Oh, Lord, ain' nobody to help me.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: What's de matter?

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Porgy woman very sick more'n a week now;
she gone to the picnic ain'
get los' in de jungle.
She ain' come home for two day.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I think dat maybe she goin' to sleep now; a whole
week gone now an' she ain' no better.
Hello, Peter, welcome back home, ole frien'.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I advise you to send her to de white folks hospital.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, Gawd, don' let 'em take Bess to the hospital!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Hospital!
Mus' be you is all forget how
I pray Clara' baby out of the convulsions.
There ain' never been a sick person
or corpse in Catfish Row dat I
has refused my prayers.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Dat's right, sistuh, you pray over her.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Oh, doctor Jesus, who done trouble de water in de Sea of Gallerie.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Amen!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: An' likewise who done cas' de devil out of de afflicted
time an' time again.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Time an' time again.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Oh, My Jesus!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Oh, doctor Jesus,
what make you ain' lay yo' han'
on dis po' sister head?

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: Oh, My Father!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: An' chase de devil out of her down a steep place
into de sea like you used to do time an' time again.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Time an' time again. Oh, my Jesus!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Lif' dis po' cripple up out of de dus'!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Allelujah!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: An' lif' up his woman an' make her well
time an' time again,
an' save us all for Jesus sake, Amen.

sp.speaker: PORGY, PETER
sp.l: Amen.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: All right.
Now, Porgy, Doctor Jesus done take de case.
By five o'clock dat woman goin' be well.

div.stage: (It is now full morning and Catfish Row is full of activity with street vendors calling.)

sp.speaker: STRAWBERRY WOMAN
sp.l: Oh dey's so fresh an' fine
An' dey's jus' off de vine
Strawberries, strawberries, strawberries,
Oh, dey's so fresh an' fine
An' dey's just off de vine,
Strawberries, strawberries, strawberries,

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Here come de honey man,
Yes mam, this de honey man.

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Oh, honey man, honey man!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: You got honey in the comb.
Yes mam, I got honey in the comb.

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Hey there! I wants some honey!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: An' is yo' honey cheap?

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: Peter, honey man!

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Yes mam, my honey very cheap,
here come de honey man.

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: Gawd amighty, I's jus' wasting my breath on you,
'Cause you ain' never goin' to hear no how.

sp.speaker: CRAB MAN
sp.l: I'm talkin' about devil crabs
1'm talkin' about devil crabs
I'm talkin' about de food I sells
She crab, she crab.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: On yo' way, brother.

sp.speaker: CRAB MAN
sp.l: Devil crab!

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Hey, crab man!

sp.speaker: CRAB MAN
sp.l: I'm talkin' about de food I sells
When I done talkin' about de food I sells
Talkin' about devil crab.
sp.stage: (Maria picks crab, counts out money, pays Crab man, who then leaves.)
sp.l: Now I's talkin' about yo' pocketbook
I'm talkin' about devil crabs, she crab, she crab,
Devil crab, I'm talkin' about de food I sells.

div.stage: (Bell chimes five times. - Looks at Porgy.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Now de time, oh Gawd, now de time.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Porgy, Porgy, dat you there, ain' it?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Thank Gawd, thank Gawd!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I lonesome here all by myself, it's hot in there,
let me sit here with you in the cool.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, Bess! Bess!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I been sick, ain't I?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: You been very sick.
But now I got you back, Bess.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: How long I been sick?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Over a week now.
You come back from Kittiwah with eye like fireball,
an' Maria get you into bed,
an' you ain' know me.
What is de matter, Bess?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I guess I ain' know nuttin' wid de fever,
or I ain' come back at all.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Dat's all right Honey, don't you worry,
Honey, I know you been with Crown.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: How you know?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Gawd give cripple to understan' many
things he ain' give strong men.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You ain' want me to go 'way?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: No, no, I ain' want you to go.
How things stan' between you an' Crown?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: He's comin' for me when de cotton come to town.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: You goin'?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I tell 'im, yes.
Porgy, Gawd, man!
Why yo' muscle pull up like that?
It make me afraid.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: You ain' got nuttin' to be afraid of;
I ain' try to keep no woman
what don't want to stay.
If you wants to go to Crown,
Dat's for you to say.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I wants to stay here, but I ain't worthy.
You is too decent to understan'.
For when I see him he hypnotize me.
When he take hold of me with his hot hand.
Someday I know he's coming back to call me.
He's goin' to handle me an' hold me so.
It's goin' to be like dyin', Porgy, deep inside me -
But when he calls, I know I have to go.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: If dere warn't no Crown, Bess,
if dere was only jus' you an' Porgy, what den?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I loves you, Porgy,
Don' let him take me,
Don' let him handle me an' drive me mad.
If you kin keep me,
I wants to stay here wid you forever,
An' I'd be glad.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: There, there, Bess, you don' need to be afraid no mo',
You's picked up happiness and laid yo' worries down.
You goin' to live easy, you goin' to live high.
You goin' to outshine every woman in dis town.
An' remember, when Crown come
that's my business, Bess!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I loves you, Porgy,
Don' let him take me
Don' let him handle me
With his hot han'
If you kin keep me
I wants to stay here wid you forever.
I got my man.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: What you think I is, anyway,
To let dat dirty houn' dog steal my woman?
If you wants to stay wid Porgy, you goin' stay.
You got a home now, Honey, an' you got love.
So no mo' cryin', can't you understan'?
You goin' to go about yo' business, singin' 'cause
You got Porgy, you got a man.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Why you been out on that wharf so long, Clara?
You got no cause to worry 'bout yo' man.
Dis goin' be a fine d\C3 y.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: I never see de water look so black.
It sits there waitin', holdin' its breath,
list'nin' for dat hurricane bell.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Hurricane bell!
Lawd chile, dere ain' goin' be no hurricane.
I's gettin' ole now an' I ain' hear dat bell
but fo' time in my life.
Go 'long to de baby now an' quiet down.

div.stage: (The wind rises. Heads appear at windows and faces show terror. People pass, shouting warnings. The deep ominous clang of a bell is heard. It keeps striking. Wind increases- clouds deepen - People from court move about in terror.)

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Jake! Jake!

div.head: Scene 4
div.stage: (Everyone huddles in fear from the tremendous storm outside. They try to drown out the storm with singing.)

sp.speaker: SECOND SOPRANO SOLO
sp.l: Oh, Doctor Jesus, look down on me wit' pity.
Put Yo' lovin' arms thru de roof of dis house
an' lif' me to Yo' bosom till de storm is over.
Oh, Doctor Jesus, look down on me
Why is You angry wit' dis po' sinner?
Why is You cryin' dose tears, an' mumblin' dat thunder
When I ain' got nuthin' but rev'rence
in me heart for you, Lawd.
Oh, Doctor Jesus, look down on me.
If You is lookin' down on me wit' disfavor
I ain' know what to do 'cause if worshippin'
You ain' stoppin' dose tears an' dat thunder,
Lawd, I ain' know jes' what to do, Lawd.
Oh, Doctor Jesus, look down on me I's beseechin' You
to look down on me wit' pity an' I's hopin'
You's about to put Yo' lovin' arms thru de roof
of dis house an lif' me to Yo' bosom, Amen...

sp.speaker: TENOR SOLO
sp.l: Oh, Lawd above, we knows You can destroy,
But we also knows You can raise,
an' we's beseechin' You to raise Yo' fallen chillen.
Oh, Lawd above, You got de pow'r to feed us,
You got the pow'r to clothe us,
an' You can lead us out of de wilderness.
Yes Lawd, but we's not hungry now, an' we's got clo'es,
but we is askin' You to lead us out of de wilderness.
Oh, Lawd above, lead us out of de wilderness, into de
Golden Meadows an' de Silvery Streams.
Oh, Lawd above, we know You can destroy,
but we knows You can raise, too,
an' we's askin' You for Yo' assistance
in dis time of storm an' thunder an' lightnin'.
Oh, Lawd above, we warrants Yo'assistance an' we's
beseechin' You to raise Yo' fallen chillen, Amen...

sp.speaker: FIRST SOPRANO SOLO
sp.l: Oh, Hev'nly Father, hab mercy on we,
look down wit' grace an' sympathy,
You whose po'chillen we is, show we how
You can protect Yo'chillen when dey is deserving.
Oh, Hev'nly Father, hab mercy on we when
de clouds an' de storms start raisin' hell upon dis earth.
We knows dat You can fix' em,
'cause You is de great fixer.
Oh my Father fix dat Satan,
Tie up his hands an' his feet
An' t'row him back where he belong.
Oh, Hev'nly Father, hab mercy on we,
'cause we is Yo' deservin' chillen. Amen.
Oh, Hev'nly Father, hab mercy on we
wit' grace an ' sympathy an' understandin' of which we knows You got plenty.
Oh, my Lawd, Amen.

sp.speaker: ALTO SOLO
sp.l: Professor Jesus, teach Yo' ignorant chillen
how to combat de fires an' torments of dat black visitation from below.
We leans on You Professor Jesus, what die on Calbery.
Dispense Yo' blessings on Yo' needful
An' Yo' grateful followers.
Cast away dose black clouds an' de darkness
an' show we de golden sunshine gleaming once again.
Professor Jesus, teach yo' ignorant chillen,
cast away dose black clouds etc.,
An' show we de golden sunshine
Shin' on de fields an' de meadows
an' de mountains an' de plains, Amen.

sp.speaker: FIRST BASS SOLO
sp.l: Oh, Captain Jesus, find it in Yo' heart to save us,
I's given You six chillen to add to Yo' legions,
my po' wife is now wid You three year dis October,
Oh, Captain Jesus, but we is seven left to tell
Dat Satan man where he get off at.
We has all lived sweetly an' sweetly
We is willin' to die for You.
Oh, Captain Jesus, we knows how sweetly You treats
Yo' soldiers, when You opens the gates for dem.
Oh, Captain Jesus, find it in Yo' heart
To save us worshippers
'Cause there is no truer followers of de Lawd
Den what's prayin' to You now.
Oh, Captain Jesus, we has all lived sweetly an' sweetly
We is willin' to die for You, Amen.

sp.speaker: SECOND BASS SOLO
sp.l: Oh, Father, what die on Calbery, we's dependin' on You
we's leanin' on You to ease the rocky way,
we's been trablin' de straight an' narrow path
Dat ends in glory.
Oh, Father, what die on Calbery,
darkness has descended, we all knows it's temporary,
Lawd, but' de sooner it disappears,
de sooner we gets goin' to You, Lawd.
Oh, Father, what die on Calbery,
maybe we is po' misable sinners,
but we certainly tries all de live long day
to follow Yo' teachings.
Lawd, Oh, Father, if we ain' been doin jus' what You
is wishin' us to do it ain' because we ain' been tryin',
'Cause we is been tryin' to follow Yo' sacred teachin's
all de live long day, Amen.

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Lawd, hab mercy.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Oh, de Lawd shake de Heavens
an' de Lawd rock de groun'.
Ah - An' where you goin' stand,
my brudder an' my sister,
When de sky come atumblin' down.
Oh, de sun goin' to rise in de wes'.

sp.speaker: MAN
sp.l: My Jesus.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: An' de moon goin' to set in de sea -

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: My Saviour.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: An' de stars goin' to bow befo' my Lawd,
bow down befo' my Lawd
Who died on Calvarie.
Oh, de Lawd raise de water an' de hypocrite drown
An' where you goin' stand, etc.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Clara, come sing wid us, sister, ain' you know,
song make you forget yo' trouble.
An' lif' up dat burden of sorrow offen yo' heart.

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: I 'mos' lose my mind wid yo' singing only
dat one song over an' over since daylight yesterday.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: We got to be ready singin' praises
to de Lawd when Gabriel soun'
dat trumpet an' de graveya'ds spew up de dead.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: We had storm befo', I ain't so sure this is
Judgment Day.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Well, anyhow, it ain' no time fo' takin' no chances.

div.stage: (There is a sudden burst of wind, lightning and thunder.)

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: One of dese mornings you goin' to rise up singin',
Den you'll spread yo wings an' you'll take de sky,
But till dat morning dere's a nothin' can harm you
Wid Daddy an' Mammy standin' by.

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Lawd hab mercy on our soul.
Oh, de sun goin' to rise in de wes' etc.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: What make you so still, Bess,
You ain' sayin' nuttin'
You ain' afraid, is you Honey?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I jus' thinkin', an' you know what I's thinkin' about?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: You's thinkin' what dis storm mus' be like
atramplin' over de sea islands,
Dese waves mus' be runnin' clean across Kittiwah.
Ain' nobody could live on dat damn island
in a storm like dis.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: I guess you got me for keeps, Porgy.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Ain'I tell you dat all along?

div.stage: (Lightning flash and the roar of storm drown out singing. There is fearful screaming and shouting.)

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Oh, dere's somebody knockin' at de do',
Oh, dere's somebody knockin' at de do',
Oh, Mary, Oh, Marta,
dere's somebody knockin' at de do'.
Oh, dere's somebody etc.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I hear Death knockin' at de do'.

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: What you say, Daddy Peter?

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: I hear Death knockin' at de do'.

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: It mus' be death or Peter can't hear 'im.
He can't hear no livin' pusson.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: He ain't hear nuttin', ain' nobody knock.

sp.speaker: PETER
sp.l: Death knockin' at de do'.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Open de do', Mingo,
an' show Peter dere ain' nobody dere.

sp.speaker: MINGO
sp.l: Open um up yo'self.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: All right, I'll show you.
sp.stage: (Suddenly - several sharp knocks on door. Cries of terror. More knocks - the door shakes violently. Men leaning against it.)

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Dat ain' no use, if he's Death,
he comin anyway.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: Oh, Gawd, Gawd, don't let 'im in.
sp.stage: (The door slowly gives way inward, pushing men back. Wind, shrieks, prayers, men fall back. Crown enters.)

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: You is a nice parcel of Christians!
Shut a friend out in a storm like dis!

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: Who' frien' is you?

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: I's yo' frien', Sister.
Oh, here's de woman I's lookin' fo'.
Why you ain' come an' say hello to yo' man?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You ain't my man!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: It's sho' time I was comin' back for you, sweet Bess!
You ain't done much for yo'self while I been gone.
Ain' dere no whole ones left?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You keep yo' mouth off Porgy.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Woman, do you want to meet yo' Gawd?
Come here!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Porgy my man now!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Well, for Gawd sake, does you call dat a man?
Well don' you min', I got de forgivin' nature an'
I goin' take you back.
sp.stage: (He grabs Bess. Porgy rises to defend her, but Crown throws him back to the floor.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Turn dat woman loose!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Keep yo' han' off me.

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: You bes' behave yo'self in dis sturm!
Don' you know, Gawd might strike you dead!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: If Gawd want to kill me,
He had plenty of chance 'tween
here an' Kittiwah Island.
Me an' Him havin' it out all de way from Kittiwah,
firs' Him on top, den me on top.
There ain' nothin' He likes better den
a scrap wid a man.
Gawd an' me is frien'!
Hear dat? Gawd's laughin' at you!

sp.speaker: WOMAN
sp.l: Oh, de Lawd shake de Heavens
an' de Lawd ruck de groun'

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Ah, ah, ah,
An' where you goin' stan', my brudder an' my sister,
when de sky come tumblin' down, etc.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Here, cut dat out! Stop it!
I didn't come all the way from Kittiwah
to sit up wid no corpses.
Dem dat is in such a hurry to meet de Judgement,
All dey gots to do is kiss dereselves goodbye
an' step out dat door.
Daddy Peter, here's yo' chance.
De Jim-crow's leavin' an' you don' need noticket.
How about you, ole lady? What, dere ain'no travellers?
Don' you hear Gawd a'mighty laughin' at you?
Dat's right, Gawd laugh an' Crown laugh back.
Ha, ha, ha, ha Dat s right,
drown em out, don let em sing. Ha, ha, ha, ha!
How 'bout dis one, Big Frien'?
A red-headed woman makes a cho-choo jump its track.
A red-headed woman she can make it jump right back.
Oh, she's jus' nature's child,
She's got somethin' dat drives men wild.
A red-headed woman's gonna take you wedder you're
White, yellow or black.
But show me the red-head that kin make a fool of me!
Oh, she ain' existin' on de lan' or on de sea.
Oh, you kin knock me down
If dey don't fall for Brudder Crown.
Oh, show me de redhead
dat kin make a goddam fool of me.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Lawd, Lawd, save us, don t listen to dat Crown, Lawd,
Jesus, oh, pay no min' to dat Crown
Oh, Lawd, strike him down, strike him down.
Oh, Lawd, don't listen to dat Crown.

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Oh show me de redhead that can make a fool of me,
Oh, she ain't existin' on de land or on de sea.
Oh you kin knock me down
if they don't fall for Brudder Crown.
Oh, show me de redhead
dat can make a goddam fool of,
I said a fool out o' me!

div.stage: (Clara, at the window screams and falls back.)

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Jake's boat in de river, upside down!

sp.speaker: CLARA
sp.l: Jake! Jake!
Bess, keep my baby for me till I get back!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Clara oughtn't to be out dere all by herself.
Won't somebody go to Clara?
Ain't dere no man here?

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: Yeah, where is a man?
Porgy, what you sittin' dere for?
Ain't you hear yo' woman callin' for a man?
Looks to me like dere ain' only one man 'roun' here!
All right, I'm goin' out to get Clara,
then I'm comin' back to get you.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: No, you don't!

sp.speaker: CROWN
sp.l: All right, Big Frien', we's on for another bout!

div.stage: (Crown opens door and plunges out. Roar.)

sp.speaker: SINGERS
sp.l: Oh, Doctor Jesus, look down on me wit'pity, etc...
Oh, Lawd above, we knows You can destroy, etc...
Oh, Captain Jesus, find it in Yo' heart to save us, etc...
Professor Jesus, teach Yo' ignorant chillen, etc...
Oh, Father what die on Calbery, etc...
Oh, Hev'nly Father, hab mercy on we, etc...
Amen!

div.head: Scene 1
div.stage: (The storm has ended. It is dusk.)

sp.speaker: CHORUS
sp.l: Clara, Clara, don't you be downhearted,
Clara, Clara, don't you be sad an' lonesome.
Jesus is walkin' on de water.
Rise up an' follow Him home.
Oh, Lawd, oh my Jesus, rise up an' follow Him home.
Jake, Jake, don't you be downhearted,
Jake, Jake, don't you be sad an' lonesome, etc.
Crown, Crown, don t you be downhearted.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Ha, ha, ha, ha,

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: You low-lived skunk, ain' you got no shame,
laughin' at those po' womens whaf's singin'
for their mens los' in the storm!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: I ain't see no sense in makin' such a fuss
over a man when he's dead;
when a gal loses her man dere's plenty o' men
still livin' what likes good lookin' gals.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: I know it ain' dem gals you is after,
ain' you see, Bess got no use for you, ain' you see she got a man?

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: I see more'n dat, Auntie, I see she got two men.

sp.speaker: MARIA
sp.l: What you mean by dat?
Bess got two men. Crown dead ain' he?

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: I ain' tellin' you nothin',
but a woman who got jus' one man,
maybe she got him for keeps,
but when she got two mens,
there's mighty apt to be a carvin',
den de cops comes in an' takes de leavin's.
An' pretty soon she ain't got none.

div.stage: (Maria enters shop. Sporting Life goes off.)

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Summertime an' the livin' is easy,
Fish are jumpin' an'the cotton is high.
Oh yo' daddy's rich an yo' ma's good lookin'
so hush, little baby, don' you cry, Ah.
sp.stage: (Crown enters the empty courtyard and picks his way stealthily across the court. Dropping to his hands and knees he crawls toward Porgy's door. Above Crown, the shutter opens slowly. An arm is extended, the hand grasping a long knife. The arm descends plunging the knife into Crown's back. The knife is withdrawn and hurled into court. Crown staggers upright as Porgy leans from window and closes both hands around his throat. They struggle at the window, and Porgy kills Crown, hurling the body into the courtyard.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Bess, Bess, you got a man now, you got Porgy!

div.head: Scene 2

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Wait for us at the corner, Al.
We'll put the widow through first.
sp.stage: (Climbs steps to Serena's window knocks and descends to court.)
sp.l: Come on down Serena Robbins,
and makeit damn quick!

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: Huh! Serena been very sick in her bed three day
an' I been here with her all de time.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: The hell she has. Tell her if she don't come.
down I'll get the wagon and run her in.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Where were you last night, Serena Robbins?

sp.speaker: SERENA
sp.l: I been sick in dis bed three day an' three night.

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: An' we been nursin' her all dat time.

sp.speaker: LILY
sp.l: Dat's de Gawd's truth.

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: Would you swear to that?

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.l: Yes, boss, we swear to that.

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: There you are, an air-tight alibi.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Just two months ago right here
Crown killed your husband, didn't he?
Answer me, you'll either talk here or in jail.
Did Crown kill you husband, yes or no?

sp.speaker: WOMEN
sp.l: We swear to dat, boss.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: And last night Crown got his right here, didn't he?

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: Go 'long, boss, ain' dat gentleman say we is "alabi"?

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Was Crown killed here - yes or no?

sp.speaker: SERENA, ANNIE, LILY
sp.l: We ain' see nuttin' boss.
We been in dis room three day an' night
an' de window been closed.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Look at me, Serena Robbins.
Do you mean to tell me that the man who killed
your husband was bumped off under your window,
and you didn't know it?

sp.speaker: SERENA, ANNIE, WOMAN
sp.l: We ain' see nuttin' Boss.
We been in dis room three days an' nights.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Three days and nights!

sp.speaker: ANNIE
sp.l: An' de window been closed.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: You needn't do that one again.
Oh hell! You might as well argue with a parrot,
but you'll never break their story.
But I'll get you a witness for your inquest.
Step over here an' I'll put the cripple through.
sp.stage: (Goes to Porgy's door and kicks it open violently.)
sp.l: Come out both of you there, step lively now!

div.stage: (Bess helps Porgy to the doorstep, then she stands by him, the baby in her arms. Sporting Life enters court and silently watches.)

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: What is your name?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Jus' Porgy. You knows me, boss,
You done give me plenty of pennies on Meetin' Street.

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: Of course - you're the goat man,
I didn't know you with no wagon.
I'm the coroner, not a policeman.
Now this dead one, Crown,
you knew him by sight, didn't you?
You'd know him if you saw him again?

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Yes, boss, seems like I remember him,
when he used to come 'round' here long time ago.
But I ain' care none' bout seein' him.

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Well, you've got to see him anyway. Come along.

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: You needn't be afraid.
All you've got to do is to view the body
as a witness, and tell us who it is.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I got to go an' look at Crown's face...

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: Yes, that's all.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: With all dem white folks lookin' at me?

sp.speaker: CORONER
sp.l: Oh cheer up.
I reckon you've seen a dead body before.
It'll all be over in a few minutes.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: There ain' goin' be nobody in dat room 'cept me?

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Just you an' Crown, if you can still call him one.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Boss, I couldn't jus' bring a woman with me?
I...I couldn't even carry my woman?

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: No! You can't bring anyone.
I'll send an officer to help you out.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Boss, boss...

sp.speaker: DETECTIVE
sp.l: Now get this...
I have summoned you an' you have to go.
or you'll go to jail for contempt of court.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, Lawd what I goin' do?

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You've got to go Porgy,
maybe you can jus' make like to look at
him an' keep yo' eye shut;
You goin' be alright, Porgy.
You only goin' be a witness.

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: I ain' so sure of that.
All I know is that when the man that killed Crown
go in that room - an' look
at himCrown' wound begin to bleed!

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Oh, my Jesus!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: That's one way the cops got of tellin' who killed him.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I can't look at Crown's face
Oh Gawd, what I goin' do?

sp.speaker: POLICEMAN
sp.l: Hey, you there, come along!

div.stage: (They start dragging Porgy to the gate.)

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: I ain' goin' look on his face!

sp.speaker: POLICEMAN
sp.l: Oh, you'll look all right.

sp.speaker: PORGY
sp.l: Turn me loose, turn me loose you can't make his face!
Ain't nobody can make me look on Crown's face!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Oh, Gawd!
They goin' make him look on Crowns's face!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Sister, that Porgy ain' goin' be no witness now.
They goin' lock him up in jail.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Lock him up?
Not for long, Sportin' Life!

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: Not for long.
Maybe one year, maybe two year,
maybe just like I tol' you, ain' nobody home now
but Bess and ole Sportin' Life.
But cheer up, sistuh,
Ole Spurtin' Life givin' you de stuff for scare away,
dem lonesome blues.

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: Happy dus'! I ain' want none of dat stuff,
I tells you. Take dat stuff away, Buzzard!

div.stage: (Sporting Life almost forces Bess to take the dope. She suddenlly yields and claps her hand over her mouth.)

sp.speaker: SPORTING LIFE
sp.l: That's the thing, ain' it?
An' membuh there's plenty more where that come from.
Listen: There's a boat dat's leavin' soon for New York.
Come wid me, dat's where we belong, sister.
You an' me kin live dat high life in New York.
Come wid me, dere you can't go wrong, sister.
I'll buy you de swellest mansion
Up on upper Fi'th Avenue
An' through Harlem we'll go struttin',
We'll go astruttin',
An' dere'll be nuttin'
Too good for you.
I'll dress you in silks and satins
In de latest Paris styles.
And de blues you'll be forgettin',
You'll be forgettin',
There'll be no frettin'
Jes nothin' but smiles.
Come along wid me, Hey dat's de place,
Don't be a fool, come along, come along.
There's a boat dat's leavin' soon for New York
Come wid me, dat's where we belong, sister,
Dat's where we belong!
Come on, Bess!

sp.speaker: BESS
sp.l: You low, crawlin' hound!
